extracted_playbook.title: Implement Recovery Plan
extracted_playbook.description: Maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location (i.e., hard drive, storage device, the cloud).

extracted_playbook.title: Enforce NIST Password Standards
extracted_playbook.description: Require all accounts with password logins to comply with NIST standards for developing and managing password policies. Use longer passwords consisting of at least 8 characters and no more than 64 characters in length. Store passwords in hashed format using industry-recognized password managers. Add password user 'salts' to shared login credentials. Avoid reusing passwords. Implement multiple failed login attempt account lockouts. Disable password 'hints.' Refrain from requiring password changes more frequently than once per year.

extracted_playbook.title: Require Administrator Credentials for Software Installation
extracted_playbook.description: Require administrator credentials to install software.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Multifactor Authentication
extracted_playbook.description: Require multifactor authentication for all services to the extent possible, particularly for webmail, virtual private networks, and accounts that access critical systems.

extracted_playbook.title: Keep Systems Updated
extracted_playbook.description: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date. Prioritize patching SonicWall firewall vulnerabilities and known exploited vulnerabilities in internet-facing systems.

extracted_playbook.title: Segment Networks
extracted_playbook.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware by controlling traffic flows between subnetworks and restricting adversary lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Network Monitoring Tools
extracted_playbook.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of ransomware with a network monitoring tool. Implement a tool that logs and reports all network traffic, including lateral movement activity.

extracted_playbook.title: Install and Update Antivirus Software
extracted_playbook.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real-time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

extracted_playbook.title: Review and Audit Accounts
extracted_playbook.description: Review domain controllers, servers, workstations, and active directories for new and/or unrecognized accounts. Audit user accounts with administrative privileges and configure access controls according to the principle of least privilege.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Unused Ports
extracted_playbook.description: Disable unused ports to reduce potential attack vectors.

extracted_playbook.title: Add Email Banners and Disable Hyperlinks
extracted_playbook.description: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside your organization. Disable hyperlinks in received emails.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Time-Based Access for Admin Accounts
extracted_playbook.description: Implement time-based access for accounts set at the admin level and higher using the Just-in-Time (JIT) access method.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Command-Line and Scripting Activities
extracted_playbook.description: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions to prevent privilege escalation and lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Maintain Offline Backups
extracted_playbook.description: Maintain offline backups of data and regularly maintain backup and restoration. Ensure all backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organizationâ€™s data infrastructure.
